name: Bill Schindler
introduction: Bill Schindler (born 6 March 1909 and died 20 September 1952) was an American racing driver who participated in the AAA Championship Car series between 1950 and 1952. His results in the Indianapolis 500 were counted towards the Formula One championship, although he scored no points. He is one of only three drivers to race in the Indianapolis 500 with a prosthetic leg, having lost his left leg in a racing accident in 1936.
